existing_stories.title: Story 8.1: Fraud Pattern Detection Models
existing_stories.description: Story 8.1: Fraud Pattern Detection Models As a Fraud Analyst, I want AI models detecting fraudulent dispute patterns to prevent losses. Acceptance Criteria: Detect rapid multi-merchant disputes, known fraud patterns, claim/evidence inconsistencies, device/location anomalies, behavioral indicators, organized ring signals. Output fraud probability scores; high-risk flagged; trained on confirmed fraud; minimize false positives.  Prerequisites: Epic 2-3 data, Epic 1 Feature 1.2 Technical Notes: Classification ensemble (GBM/NN); feature engineering (velocity, behavior); real-time scoring; threshold tuning; retraining schedule; store predictions.

existing_stories.title: Story 5.6: Customer Notification for Credit Actions
existing_stories.description: User Story: As a Customer,I want to be notified when credits are posted or reversed,So that I understand my account activity and dispute status. Acceptance Criteria: Notification triggers on provisional credit issuance, reversal, or permanent conversion. Message includes credit/debit amount and effective transaction date. Reason for action displayed (provisional issuance, case won, case lost, partial outcome). Dispute reference (ID and short description) included. Account balance impact clearly stated (before/after or delta). Next steps or confirmation of final resolution provided. Contact information and support escalation paths included. Customer channel preferences respected (email, SMS, push, in-app). Regulatory disclosure requirements met for Reg E / Reg Z communications. Delivery status recorded; failures retried with backoff and surfaced in ops dashboard.  Prerequisites: Stories 5.4-5.5 (credit operations), Epic 7 Feature 7.1 / 7.2 (notification & personalization platform) Technical Notes: Use centralized notification service; template variables: dispute_id, action_type, amount, reason_code, effective_date, balance_delta. Implement idempotent send (message key = dispute_id + action_type + effective_date). Capture delivery receipts for audit. Provide multi-language support extension point. Include unsubscribe/manage-preference link where channel requires. Log events to analytics for customer comm effectiveness.

existing_stories.title: Story 5.5: Timeline Tracking and Automatic Reversal
existing_stories.description: User Story: As a System, I want to track provisional credit timelines and reverse when appropriate, so that temporary credits are managed according to case outcomes. Acceptance Criteria: Timeline stores issuance date, amount, investigation deadline Case outcome (won/lost/partial/pending) continuously monitored Automatic reversal trigger for lost cases executes successfully Permanent credit conversion applied for won cases Partial outcomes produce proportional reversal Customer notification 5–7 days before scheduled reversal Reversal failures escalated immediately Audit trail captures all reversal attempts & results Success/failure reversal rates tracked SLA compliance for reversal execution monitored  Prerequisites: Story 5.4 (banking integration), Epic 4 Feature 4.3 (case outcomes). Technical Notes: Implement scheduler scanning active provisional credits daily. Use state machine for credit status (temporary, pending-conversion, permanent, reversed). Notifications via unified messaging service. Reversal idempotency key prevents double reversal. Metrics exported for finance reconciliation.

existing_stories.title: Story 5.1: Regulatory Compliance Rules Engine
existing_stories.description: User Story: As a Compliance Officer, I want provisional credit rules that comply with regulations, so that we meet Reg E and Reg Z requirements automatically. Acceptance Criteria: Reg E (debit): 10-day provisional credit requirement enforced Reg Z (credit): billing dispute timeline rules applied Account type (checking/savings/credit) correctly determined Error vs fraud classification influences rule path Investigation timeline (45 days standard, 90 days exceptions) tracked Reversal conditions defined (lost case, partial outcome adjustments) Rules documented with regulatory references Rule changes version-controlled with effective dates Compliance reports generated (summary & detailed) Exceptions flagged for manual review  Prerequisites: Epic 2 Feature 2.3 (validated disputes), Epic 3 Feature 3.3 (classification signals). Technical Notes: Implement rules engine with auditable execution context. Store regulatory reference codes per rule node. Provide simulation mode for upcoming rule versions. Capture SHER (Source, History, Execution, Result) tuple for each evaluation for regulators.
